Spending time with her little sister was something that Y/N looked forward to. And so, she would have Jasmine stay over as often as she could, and then would let Eric stay over at different times so she got quality time with each of them. The tradition had started when Y/N was still at university, where she would invite her younger siblings to hers for the night every so often so they could spend time together-even with her parents not being fully into the idea of their 12 year old children staying at their sister’s university house where people would drink often. Though Y/N had set a house rule that whenever the twins were visiting, no one could smoke or drink in or around the house, and everyone understood and appreciated the rule so there was never any issue.

When Y/N bought her house in Kensington, however, she could have her siblings stay over more often which was a blessing for both her and her parents. It allowed her to see her siblings more often and allowed her parents to have an evening to themselves and keep their romance alive. One of her biggest fears was that her parents would split because they didn’t get to spend much time together, and so, she took her siblings out of the house every now and then to allow them their quality time.

“I like Harry.” Y/N turned to her sister who sat opposite her on the singular chair of the living room. A blanket wrapped around her body and her head leaning against a cushion she had taken from the sofa where Y/N sat.

“Yeah?”

“Hmm, he’s lovely.” Jasmine turned to her sister with a soft smirk, her facial features almost mirroring her big sister. She watched as Y/N started to grow uncomfortable under her stare, pulling the blanket further up her body and under her chin. “Adores you, too.”

Jasmine may have been young, but she wasn’t naïve, she say the way Harry looked at Y/N when she answered the door to him. She say the way he wrapped his arms around her and held her tight for longer than a normal hug would last. And, she definitely saw the way that his eyes lingered on her lips for a millisecond before he pulled away. Jasmine made sure to sit on the single chair when she found out that Harry would be ‘crashing’ girls’ night as Y/N had said it, so that her sister could sit next to Harry.

“No, he doesn’t.” Y/N turned her attention back to the TV which played 10 Things I Hate About You-the film that always got shown when the sisters were together. Her heart rate increased thinking about Harry who had offered to collect their Chinese food for them rather than waiting for delivery.

“Y/N, the first thing he did when he walked through the door was wrap his arms around you. He held you so freaking tight and the smile on his face was like the one dad gives to mum when he sees her. He bloody adores you.”

“You’re seeing things.” Y/N pulled the blanket off her slightly so she could bring her knees to her chest and rest her chin on them. “I’m glad you like him though.”

“Do you not like him?”

Y/N looked to her sister in offence, her eyes wide and mouth parted lightly.

“Obviously I do! That’s why I asked if you would mine him coming and crashing girls’ night.” Jasmine nodded, removing the blanket that was around her body so she could get her drink that sat on the coffee table.

“If you like him enough to let him come over when it’s girls’ night-which I don’t mind because he’s lovely and it’s good to see you really happy-, then you must like him enough to get into a relationship with him.”

Y/N’s attention was turned back to the TV as she though about Jasmine’s words. She had asked if he wanted to spend the night when she knew her sister would be there. They’d kissed before and it was nice, and he’d stopped over at her house numerous times since she’d gotten back from New York. So why weren’t they in a relationship? What was holding them back?

“Bug, you’re delusional.”

“And you’re bluffing.” Y/N rolled her eyes at her little sister who just laughed under her breath, getting herself comfortable once more in her seat and turning her attention to the TV, thinking that she had won the discussion.

“Even if I did like him that way, he doesn’t feel the same so you know…”

“You keep telling yourself that.”

The sisters fell into a comfortable silence as the film played before them. Y/N’s attention wasn’t fully on the film before her though. No, it was on Harry. She’d known the man for a mere three months and she was certain that she had feelings for him but she wasn’t sure if he felt the same. And if he did feel the same, how the fuck was she meant to tell him or start something with him? She’d never experienced something like that and it was scaring her to think about it.

“It’d be cute if someone were to do such a grand gesture in real life. Like he liked her enough to hijack the school sound system to ask her to prom.” Y/N’s attention finally turned back to the TV where Heath Ledger’s character-Patrick Verona- was singing ‘Can’t Take My Eyes Off of You’ while running away from campus security. Jasmine was fixated on the screen with a smile playing at her lips while Y/N took a deep breath and smiled at her younger sister. Truth be told, that was always her favourite scene of the film, because it showed that the cold-hearted guy you first met in the film was starting to warm up to the girl he’d been paid to date.

“I’ve always loved this scene. Heath Ledger deserved better.”

“Agreed.”

“What are we agreeing on?” Y/N looked up from the TV to find Harry stood in the doorway with two bags of Chinese food and a soft smile on his face.

“Heath Ledger deserved better than to die so young.” Harry nodded as he put the bags on the table before her.

“Oh, he did! I come baring food so we can’t get too emotional about him. I’ll go grab some plates and cutlery.” Before he could move from his spot, Jasmine had stood up and made her way to the doorway, telling Harry to sit down and that she would get them.

“Do either of you want a drink while I’m out there?”

“Vodka tonic, please.” Harry and Y/N looked at each other with a chuckled while Jasmine shook her head, walking out of the room with a ‘made for each other’ under her breath which made Harry turn to Y/N with furrowed brows.

“What does she mean?”

“Nothing, ignore her.”

They mulled over the menu for a little longer before Y/N turned to Jasmine and furrowed her brows when she caught her staring.

“Have you decided what you want, bug?” Jasmine nodded, putting her phone on the table and smiling at her sister.

“I really fancy the strawberry waffles.”

“That’s what I was going to get. Harry? What do you fancy?” Harry perused the menu once more before closing it and turning to the girl he found himself falling for.

“I might get the same, nothing’s really jumping out at me today. Also, it’s on me. I’m the one who decided that we should come here so it’s only fair I pay.” Y/N widened her eyes at him, removing her arm from his and turning her body to face him.

“I can’t let you pay for it! You bought the Chinese food last night so it’s only fair that I pay for this!”

“It’s fine, love. Let me treat you both, please.” Y/N simple smiled as she took a sip of the water that was on the table for them all to share. “Thank you. Now are you both definitely wanting the strawberry waffles?” The two girls nodded and watched as Harry walked to the counter to order and pay for their food.

“What are you smiling at, bug?” Jasmine nodded her head towards Harry before turning back to her big sister.

“One, I’m not stupid about what happened last night and-“, Y/N’s eyes widened and she flung her head into her hands and put them on the table, groaning to herself and hearing her sister laugh from her spot. “and two, I see the way you look at each other. Have you finally started a bloody relationship? Because if not, it’s about god damn time you do.”

“One, it’s a good job mum isn’t here with that language, two, we haven’t started anything, and I don’t know if we even well. And three, what exactly did you hear last night?”

Jasmine shook her head lightly as she laughed, watching Y/N squirm in her seat in anticipation.

“Not a lot, I put my earphones in. And as weird as it was for me to hear the beginnings of-I’m never going to let you live that down, by the way- I’m happy that you were comfortable enough to ‘get some’.” Y/N’s eyes widened as she stared at her little sister. Never once had she heard such things leave her mouth and as much as she wanted to cry with laughter at the way it was said, she also couldn’t help but feel slightly dumbfounded by it.

“Can we stop talking about my sex life-or prior lack of- while we’re in a café please? Actually, let’s never talk about it again.”

“Are you happy that you did though?” Y/N nodded with a small smile, taking a deep breath and another sip of water as Jasmine turned her attention to her phone.

“I am. Also, you didn’t have to put your earphones in. You could have come and knocked on the door and just ruined the mood, you know.”

The sisters laughed together while Harry was stood watching them from the counter. He never thought that he’d be falling for a girl like Y/N, but he was so glad that he was. Stood waiting for the coffee he had ordered, he watched the two girls he’d left at the table interacting and Y/N’s smile never leaving her face, even when her head was down on the

table in her hands. Even when the coffee had been brought back to him, he stayed where he had been standing, watching the two interact.

He thoroughly enjoyed the way that Y/N had stolen his t-shirt that day, tucking it into her trousers and pairing it with her cardigan, a very ‘him’ outfit as he would normally say. The sleeves on the arms had been too long for her and so he spent a few moments rolling them up before they left the house, feeling the soft skin of her arm on his fingers and the goose bumps that arose when he ran them down her arms when he had finished.

Even on the car ride to the café, he kept stealing glances at her, and he knew that Jasmine was watching the entire time, but he didn’t care. He knew that Jasmine was aware of the situation with Y/N’s previous boyfriend and wanted to show her that he was a good guy and that he had her best interests at heart.

As he walked back to the table, he heard some of their conversation and his lips twitched into a silent laugh when he sat down.

“Y/N, I’ve heard mum and dad ‘get it on’ so many times that my earphones have become my muse on a night time.” Y/N’s face turned to press into Harry’s shoulder, and he laughed at her before placing a cup of coffee in front of her and watching as she smiled and took the first sip, closing her eyes at the taste.

“I’m guessing we weren’t as quiet as we tried to be last night.”

“That’s what she’s saying. I’m never going to love this down.”

Jasmine watched with an amused smile as Harry cupped Y/N’s face and brought it down so he could press a kiss to her forehead, before she saw her sister look up at him and press her lips to his own in a soft kiss. Seeing her sister happy was something that she’d always wanted, for being able to look up to a relationship of her sister’s too was something she never thought would be possible.

When the pair pulled away Harry gave Y/N a tiny wink before removing his hands and turning back to Jasmine who couldn’t help the smile that was plastered on her face.

“Can you two get married already?”

“I can’t get married to her when she’s not my girlfriend first, can I?”

“Touche. Well can you two get into a relationship already then. And then get married! Thanks.”

Everyone laughed while Harry wrapped his arm around Y/N’s shoulders and pulled her into him softly, rubbing the top of her arm and enjoying having her close.

How could he ask her to be his girlfriend when they pretty much acted like a couple already?

Spending time with her little sister was something that Y/N looked forward to. And so, she would have Jasmine stay over as often as she could, and then would let Eric stay over at different times so she got quality time with each of them. The tradition had started when Y/N was still at university, where she would invite her younger siblings to hers for the night every so often so they could spend time together-even with her parents not being fully into the idea of their 12 year old children staying at their sister’s university house where people would drink often. Though Y/N had set a house rule that whenever the twins were visiting, no one could smoke or drink in or around the house, and everyone understood and appreciated the rule so there was never any issue.

When Y/N bought her house in Kensington, however, she could have her siblings stay over more often which was a blessing for both her and her parents. It allowed her to see her siblings more often and allowed her parents to have an evening to themselves and keep their romance alive. One of her biggest fears was that her parents would split because they didn’t get to spend much time together, and so, she took her siblings out of the house every now and then to allow them their quality time.

“I like Harry.” Y/N turned to her sister who sat opposite her on the singular chair of the living room. A blanket wrapped around her body and her head leaning against a cushion she had taken from the sofa where Y/N sat.

“Yeah?”

“Hmm, he’s lovely.” Jasmine turned to her sister with a soft smirk, her facial features almost mirroring her big sister. She watched as Y/N started to grow uncomfortable under her stare, pulling the blanket further up her body and under her chin. “Adores you, too.”

- Dark King .2. / Queen To Be / Preview -

“You are glorious” He whispers,

“Now focus on what you want, my love, focus and you shall achieve it” He whispers, his breath catching your skin. The warmth causes you to shudder, small goosebumps appearing across your skin.

You look at him, but don’t seem to be able to focus, the only thing on your mind is his lips, and how they would feel against yours. Would they be soft? Would they take control and lead you, cover yours in a dominating way. Would they lead small kisses to your jaw, and down your body. Would they caress your skin and cherish you, leave small bites and marks wherever they pleased. Would they delve lower, kiss you where you wanted them most, would they make you see the stars and heavens,

“Y/N” You jump, your eyes opening to meet his,

“Are you focusing” He smiles, his lips turning upwards

“Umm yes, sorry” You reply, closing your eyes once more.

But I think that’s a clever response he uses when a song is too personal.

summary: Just a Flicker of Hope Chapter 8- Revelations
title: Just a Flicker of Hope Chapter 8- Revelations
body:
Each day that passed, Harry started to feel worse and worse. It had been a week since he last saw Felicity. He couldn’t help but feel like he had run her off. His insecurity started to get the better of him, as he started to think the worse. Terrible thoughts filled his head, and all he wanted was to know that she was okay. He was terrified that she was alone, hurt, and scared. He couldn’t sleep and could barely eat. He felt as if he were losing all sense of reality.


He still spent most of his time at Hope’s Bar, wishing she would return. No one had known where she went or how long she would be gone for. He wish he could call her and make sure everything was alright.


He showed up to the bar late one Saturday evening. He was already buzzed, when he decided to drop by. He had been drinking more and more, since he was so worried something had happened to her. He felt lost and more alone than ever.


Walking into the bar, he automatically scanned the entire room. He froze, when he spotted her behind the counter. He felt as if he were dreaming. Rubbing his eyes, he made sure he wasn’t seeing things.


Standing in the entrance way, he studied her for a moment. Although he still thought that she was the most beautiful girl, he couldn’t help but wonder if she was sick. Something about her looked majorly off. She was extremely pale and looked as if she would break down in tears at any moment. Her hair was pulled back in a tight ponytail, and she was dressed in jeans and a t-shirt.


Harry was frozen in place. Sensing someone staring, she glanced up from the counter. Meeting his curious gaze, she gave him a sad smile. His heart automatically started to break. He knew in that moment that something was very wrong.


He finally walked up the bar. Their eyes were locked onto one another, but neither one could utter a word. They just studied each other.


She was the one to finally break the silence.


“Hi,” she said just above a whisper.


Reaching out, he took her hand. “Hi.”


Looking down, she stared at his hand on hers. He could tell she was fighting back tears, but he had no idea as to why. All he knew was that he wanted to help. All he wanted was to wrap her in his arms and tell her everything would be okay.


“Is everything alright?” He asked concern evident in his voice.


He regretted his question instantly, when her head shot up and she met his eyes once more. She remained silent, as the tears escaped her tired eyes.


“I’m sorry,” she said shaking her head. She hesitantly ran from behind the counter and headed for the exit.


Harry stared after her, shocked. Without a second thought, he took off after her.


…………………..


Felicity stared at her mother’s frail body, as she tried to force herself to respond. She had no idea what to say or what to do.


“Felicity?” Her mother croaked out once more.


“Hi mom.” She whispered.


“Is that really you?”


“Yes.”


“I can’t believe you came!” she cried. “Come here so I can get a good look at you.”


Reluctantly, Felicity walked towards the hospital bed. Her emotions were all over the place. Part of her wanted to run out of the room and scream. Another part of her wanted to curl up beside her mother and cry. She felt lost and confused. Because of the drugs, she had never been close to her mother. She hated that she had been deprived of the ideal mother and daughter relationship. Her childhood had been rough, and she didn’t like to talk about it or even think about it. More than anything, she felt angry for not having a real parent to turn to.


Fighting back her emotions, she stood before her mother. She could tell that it took all her strength to keep her eyelids open. Her frail body was shaking uncontrollably, as she reached out to take her daughters hand.


“I didn’t think I would ever see you again.” She whispered.


Felicity remained quiet, reluctantly holding onto her mothers bony hand.  


“Felicity..” She started. “I am so sorry.” She choked.


It took her a moment to gather herself, in order to continue. Tears started to roll down her checks, as she poured her heart out to her daughter.


“I know I’ve never been the best mother, and I’ve hated myself for it. My demons got the best of me, and for that I am sorry. I never meant to hurt you and your brother this way. I just couldn’t handle life. Your father.. He broke me, and I’ve never been able to get over it. I’ve tried.. I really have, but I failed. I failed both of you..” She choked out.


Her words were sincere, and they took Felicity off guard. She had never been able to understand her mother, until this moment. She had always know the hell her father had put them both through, but could never understand why her mother couldn’t move past it. After all, she had been able to. For the most part anyway.


“Mom.. you don’t have to explain..” She started to say.


“Yes.. I do. I need to get the out, before it’s to late. You will never know how sorry I am for turning to drugs. It was the only escape that I could find, and I want you to know why.” She paused. “Thomas.. could you give your sister and I a moment. There are somethings I need to say to her that you don’t need to know.”


He looked between his mom and sister, and thought about her words. He had known for years that there were secrets between the two of them that they refused to share. He had asked his sister on many occasions what happened with their father, but she refused to speak of him. He had known that it was bad, but he would never know the full extent of it.


He remained silent, as he reluctantly left the two of them alone. Shutting the door quietly behind him, the room fell silent.


Felicity knew what was coming. She had yet to speak to her mother about what happened to her when she was a child. She had always known the day would could that it would need to be discussed, but she had dreaded the conversation.


“Felicity..” Her mom started once more.


“I know what you’re going to say… Please don’t. I don’t want to talk about this. Nothing we say will change the past so lets just leave it alone.” Felicity said shaking her head.


“We need to talk about this. I should have talked to you a long time ago, but could never bring myself to do it.”


“Mom..”


“Just listen okay?” She asked tightening her grip on her hands. “I want you to know that it wasn’t the abuse that made me this way. Your father.. He put me through hell, and I hate him with everything in me. But what he done to me was nothing compared to what he done to you.. Felicity.. I’m so sorry that I couldn’t stop him. I tried to, but I wasn’t strong enough.”


“Please.. stop.” Felicity begged. This was one memory that she never wanted to relive.


“Look at me,” she spoke sternly. “What he done to you was not your fault. He was a monster, and you were just a kid. You didn’t deserve to be treated that way, and I would do anything to be able to change it. What happened.. That memory has haunted me everyday since. Every time I close my eyes, I can see you as a scared child and me not being able to help. I failed you, and because of that I’ve wanted to escape.”


Felicity’s heart was breaking. She had never seen this side of her mother. When she was a kid she felt alone. She felt as if her mother never cared at all. She couldn’t remember her mother taking up for her, until now. Up until now, the only memories she had were of her father’s abuse. She could never escape his unending torment. All throughout the day, he would abuse her both mentally and physically. However, the nights were the worst. At night he would enter her room and do unspeakable things to her. She tried her best to keep him away, but she was just a kid and no match for him.


She had spent years in therapy, because of this. She still had many issues that she struggled with each and every day. It took everything in her to be able to trust anyone at all, and she had trouble in all relationships. More than anything, she wanted to be normal. She wanted to forget the trauma she experienced as a kid, but she knew that she would always carry it with her.


“It wasn’t your fault either,” Felicity finally spoke up. “He was no match for either of us. I don’t blame you for what happened. I never have.” She admitted to both her mom and herself.


They were both in tears, as they both laid there hearts out to each other. Surprising them both, Felicity laid down beside her mother. Taking both her hands in hers, she tried her best to comfort her.


“I’m sorry for not being the mother you deserved.” She cried.


“I forgive you.” Felicity said honestly. She had never thought she would utter those three words to her mother, however she did. She was finally able to forgive her for her absence as a mom. She felt as if a huge weight had been lifted from her shoulders.


They laid there in silence, both finally at peace. Felicity heard her moms breathing become heavy, and her body go limp. Looking over, she watched her sleep for a few moments. Sighing she got up to search for her brother.


…………..


It took a moment for Harry to find Felicity, outside of the bar. She was sitting with her head buried in her knees. He could see her shaking and knew she was crying. His heart broke even more. Instantly he went to her and wrapped her in his arms.


He held her as she cried, both remaining silent. More than anything, he wanted to know what was wrong, but he didn’t want to push her. He knew that she would tell him, when she was ready.


They stayed like this for quite some time. Harry held her closely and rubbed her back in soothing circles. Her body started to slowly relax, as time went by.


“I’m sorry,” she spoke finally. Lifting her head slightly, she rested it on top of her knees.


Her face was red and puffy, and Harry noticed the dark circles under her eyes. Reaching up, he wiped the tears from her cheeks.


“You have nothing to apologize, love.” He told her soothingly.


She gave him a sad smile. “Yes I do, and I definitely owe you an explanation.”


She was quiet a moment, while she tried to gather her thoughts.


“You don’t have to explain..”


“Considering we kissed, and then I disappeared, I think I do.” She sighed. “It wasn’t anything to do with you.. I promise.”


Harry felt relieved. He didn’t want to be the reason she had run off.


“It was my mom,” she spoke softly. “It was my brother that called me, when we were in the park that night. After you dropped me off, he called again. Our mom was in the hospital so I had to go to them.”


She went silent once more, lost in thought. Harry could sense there was more to the story, but he remained patient.


Felicity stayed silent. She was reluctant to go on.


“Is she alright?” Harry finally asked.


He could sense her freeze, and he knew the answer.


“No,” she whispered. “She died, last night. That’s why I’m here. I needed a little break from reality.”  She said sadly.


“I’m so sorry.” Harry said honestly. He tightened his grip on her even more.


She shrugged. “Me and my mom.. We’ve never had the best relationship. A lot of things happened to me when I was a kid, and neither one of us ever really recovered. She turned to drugs and spent her life trying to escape. Now, she finally has.”


Harry was speechless. He wasn’t sure what to say. Her life seemed to be the complete opposite of his. He was extremely close to his mother, and he couldn’t imagine not having her in his life. His heart broke in two, and he wished he knew how to help her.


“I’m sorry.” He said once more. “Is there anything I can do to help?”


“This helps.” She told him putting her head on his shoulder.


He smiled a bit and held her close. They stayed like that, both lost in thought.


“Her funeral is tomorrow.” She sighed closing her eyes.


“Can I come?” He asked reluctantly. “I would like to be there for you if that’s okay.”


“I would like that.” She smiled up at him, and she gave him a quick kiss on the cheek.


Standing up, she looked down on him. I need to get back in there. I’m only here for a few hours.


“Well I’ll keep you company,” He said raising to his feet.


She smiled once more and went to turn away. He grabbed her by the hand and pulled her back to him.


“I missed you,” he told her earnestly. Pulling her close, he softly touched his lips to hers.

He remained silent, as he reluctantly left the two of them alone. Shutting the door quietly behind him, the room fell silent.


Felicity knew what was coming. She had yet to speak to her mother about what happened to her when she was a child. She had always known the day would could that it would need to be discussed, but she had dreaded the conversation.


“Felicity..” Her mom started once more.


“I know what you’re going to say… Please don’t. I don’t want to talk about this. Nothing we say will change the past so lets just leave it alone.” Felicity said shaking her head.


“We need to talk about this. I should have talked to you a long time ago, but could never bring myself to do it.”


“Mom..”


“Just listen okay?” She asked tightening her grip on her hands. “I want you to know that it wasn’t the abuse that made me this way. Your father.. He put me through hell, and I hate him with everything in me. But what he done to me was nothing compared to what he done to you.. Felicity.. I’m so sorry that I couldn’t stop him. I tried to, but I wasn’t strong enough.”


“Please.. stop.” Felicity begged. This was one memory that she never wanted to relive.


“Look at me,” she spoke sternly. “What he done to you was not your fault. He was a monster, and you were just a kid. You didn’t deserve to be treated that way, and I would do anything to be able to change it. What happened.. That memory has haunted me everyday since. Every time I close my eyes, I can see you as a scared child and me not being able to help. I failed you, and because of that I’ve wanted to escape.”


Felicity’s heart was breaking. She had never seen this side of her mother. When she was a kid she felt alone. She felt as if her mother never cared at all. She couldn’t remember her mother taking up for her, until now. Up until now, the only memories she had were of her father’s abuse. She could never escape his unending torment. All throughout the day, he would abuse her both mentally and physically. However, the nights were the worst. At night he would enter her room and do unspeakable things to her. She tried her best to keep him away, but she was just a kid and no match for him.


She had spent years in therapy, because of this. She still had many issues that she struggled with each and every day. It took everything in her to be able to trust anyone at all, and she had trouble in all relationships. More than anything, she wanted to be normal. She wanted to forget the trauma she experienced as a kid, but she knew that she would always carry it with her.


“It wasn’t your fault either,” Felicity finally spoke up. “He was no match for either of us. I don’t blame you for what happened. I never have.” She admitted to both her mom and herself.


They were both in tears, as they both laid there hearts out to each other. Surprising them both, Felicity laid down beside her mother. Taking both her hands in hers, she tried her best to comfort her.


“I’m sorry for not being the mother you deserved.” She cried.


“I forgive you.” Felicity said honestly. She had never thought she would utter those three words to her mother, however she did. She was finally able to forgive her for her absence as a mom. She felt as if a huge weight had been lifted from her shoulders.


They laid there in silence, both finally at peace. Felicity heard her moms breathing become heavy, and her body go limp. Looking over, she watched her sleep for a few moments. Sighing she got up to search for her brother.


…………..


It took a moment for Harry to find Felicity, outside of the bar. She was sitting with her head buried in her knees. He could see her shaking and knew she was crying. His heart broke even more. Instantly he went to her and wrapped her in his arms.


He held her as she cried, both remaining silent. More than anything, he wanted to know what was wrong, but he didn’t want to push her. He knew that she would tell him, when she was ready.


They stayed like this for quite some time. Harry held her closely and rubbed her back in soothing circles. Her body started to slowly relax, as time went by.


“I’m sorry,” she spoke finally. Lifting her head slightly, she rested it on top of her knees.


Her face was red and puffy, and Harry noticed the dark circles under her eyes. Reaching up, he wiped the tears from her cheeks.


“You have nothing to apologize, love.” He told her soothingly.


She gave him a sad smile. “Yes I do, and I definitely owe you an explanation.”


She was quiet a moment, while she tried to gather her thoughts.


“You don’t have to explain..”


“Considering we kissed, and then I disappeared, I think I do.” She sighed. “It wasn’t anything to do with you.. I promise.”


Harry felt relieved. He didn’t want to be the reason she had run off.


“It was my mom,” she spoke softly. “It was my brother that called me, when we were in the park that night. After you dropped me off, he called again. Our mom was in the hospital so I had to go to them.”


She went silent once more, lost in thought. Harry could sense there was more to the story, but he remained patient.


Felicity stayed silent. She was reluctant to go on.


“Is she alright?” Harry finally asked.


He could sense her freeze, and he knew the answer.


“No,” she whispered. “She died, last night. That’s why I’m here. I needed a little break from reality.”  She said sadly.


“I’m so sorry.” Harry said honestly. He tightened his grip on her even more.


She shrugged. “Me and my mom.. We’ve never had the best relationship. A lot of things happened to me when I was a kid, and neither one of us ever really recovered. She turned to drugs and spent her life trying to escape. Now, she finally has.”


Harry was speechless. He wasn’t sure what to say. Her life seemed to be the complete opposite of his. He was extremely close to his mother, and he couldn’t imagine not having her in his life. His heart broke in two, and he wished he knew how to help her.


“I’m sorry.” He said once more. “Is there anything I can do to help?”


“This helps.” She told him putting her head on his shoulder.


He smiled a bit and held her close. They stayed like that, both lost in thought.


“Her funeral is tomorrow.” She sighed closing her eyes.


“Can I come?” He asked reluctantly. “I would like to be there for you if that’s okay.”


“I would like that.” She smiled up at him, and she gave him a quick kiss on the cheek.


Standing up, she looked down on him. I need to get back in there. I’m only here for a few hours.


“Well I’ll keep you company,” He said raising to his feet.


She smiled once more and went to turn away. He grabbed her by the hand and pulled her back to him.


“I missed you,” he told her earnestly. Pulling her close, he softly touched his lips to hers.

Each day that passed, Harry started to feel worse and worse. It had been a week since he last saw Felicity. He couldn’t help but feel like he had run her off. His insecurity started to get the better of him, as he started to think the worse. Terrible thoughts filled his head, and all he wanted was to know that she was okay. He was terrified that she was alone, hurt, and scared. He couldn’t sleep and could barely eat. He felt as if he were losing all sense of reality.


He still spent most of his time at Hope’s Bar, wishing she would return. No one had known where she went or how long she would be gone for. He wish he could call her and make sure everything was alright.


He showed up to the bar late one Saturday evening. He was already buzzed, when he decided to drop by. He had been drinking more and more, since he was so worried something had happened to her. He felt lost and more alone than ever.


Walking into the bar, he automatically scanned the entire room. He froze, when he spotted her behind the counter. He felt as if he were dreaming. Rubbing his eyes, he made sure he wasn’t seeing things.


Standing in the entrance way, he studied her for a moment. Although he still thought that she was the most beautiful girl, he couldn’t help but wonder if she was sick. Something about her looked majorly off. She was extremely pale and looked as if she would break down in tears at any moment. Her hair was pulled back in a tight ponytail, and she was dressed in jeans and a t-shirt.


Harry was frozen in place. Sensing someone staring, she glanced up from the counter. Meeting his curious gaze, she gave him a sad smile. His heart automatically started to break. He knew in that moment that something was very wrong.


He finally walked up the bar. Their eyes were locked onto one another, but neither one could utter a word. They just studied each other.


She was the one to finally break the silence.


“Hi,” she said just above a whisper.


Reaching out, he took her hand. “Hi.”


Looking down, she stared at his hand on hers. He could tell she was fighting back tears, but he had no idea as to why. All he knew was that he wanted to help. All he wanted was to wrap her in his arms and tell her everything would be okay.


“Is everything alright?” He asked concern evident in his voice.


He regretted his question instantly, when her head shot up and she met his eyes once more. She remained silent, as the tears escaped her tired eyes.


“I’m sorry,” she said shaking her head. She hesitantly ran from behind the counter and headed for the exit.


Harry stared after her, shocked. Without a second thought, he took off after her.
